Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ash r
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights over the weekend and thought the breakfast, staff and cleanliness of the place was spot on. Just watch out for steep steps and marjuana smelling rooms.

Reviews.Title: “What a spectacular DUMP!!!!”
Reviews.Author: D B
Reviews.Content: The worst experience of my life. I just about managed the ladder type stairway to doom and gloom and after one look walked out. There was not a toilet anywhere near the several rooms that end of the building, a disgusting shower cubicle on the stairwell with a sliding plastic door no privacy obviously it becomes the toilet for the several rooms. The room had no sink, mirror or anything to make your stay remotely pleasant. It should be classed as a DOSSHOUSE for vagrants at best and closed down. This is the worst accommodation I have ever seen, my money has been lost as they charge the first night which was our only night, I had to pay to stay elsewhere. When booking this accommodation it was not rated a one star hotel, the average rating on feedback is a 7 which all in all puts you off the scent of this being truly sickening.

Reviews.Title: “No serious complaints”
Reviews.Author: Wind41
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and always round to help. The room was excellent for the money we paid and although the toilet and shower were shared with 2 other rooms, we never saw anyone else at all. The hotel was easy to find and was in a great place, situated 10 minutes from the train station and a walk down the road to Dam Square and also very near the Red Light District. Overall, very impressed and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: indierocklad
Reviews.Content: This is a cheap, basic hotel right in the heart of Amsterdam, minutes from the famous cafe - The Grasshopper. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I would not recommend this hotel for people looking for a quiet night, but who goes to Amsterdam for that and stays in a 1* hotel?! A lot of these negative reviews are from people who seem to have booked the cheap option without properly considering the implications of this. If you're looking for somewhere to crash with a few friends whilst experiencing everything Amsterdam has to offer then this is somewhere I would definitely recommend. I am intending to go back to the 'Dam in the next few months and will not be looking further than here to book.

Reviews.Title: “Better value elsewhere; accessible but rowdy location and polite staff”
Reviews.Author: jasdev_sekhon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel De Mallemoolen is a friendly, hospitable hotel inbetween the Centraal Station and the Red Light District (in fact, it is at the top of Warmooestraat, one of the first streets in the RLD). As others have mentioned the staff are polite (although it's an odd kind of aloof politeness which we noticed from many other Dutch staff everywhere), there is a luggage room in the main building which you can use before or after checking in/out, there is a PC in the reception which is slow as hell but at least it works, there is a daily breakfast with some nice food and drink, and for getting to the train station or the tram terminus it's in a perfect accessible location. We stayed in Room 10, for which one must climb three increasingly steep and narrow flights of stairs (it's almost as though you're climbing into your loft/attic). A bit annoying but as long as you spend most of the day out you don't take too much notice, although in an inebriated state I'd advise caution. Our room was clean, had a small TV and sink with mirror, and a couple of bedside tables and a single chair. The room can smell of cannabis when you arrive but it's easy to latch the window open whilst you're out to keep it fresh (of course, then you have a problem of fresh cannabis smoke coming in from the many coffeeshops and residences neighbouring your room!). My girlfriend and I both suffered back pain for the first two days since the mattresses are incredibly soft, and difficult to get on/off of. The room is also quite cramped, as it is at the top of the building (although I think rooms on floors below ours might have been just as cramped for having more beds in them). Yay for being able to watch the BBC and on the Dutch channel Veronica, American sitcoms like Two and a Half Men or The Simpsons. You get a sink but you have to share the Hotel's shower rooms and toilets, which are almost never occupied when you need them but feel kinda small. Whilst we were there the shower drain begin to clog up more and more until our last night when we just gave up on having a shower at all. Our failure not to mention this to the staff, who probably could have unclogged it during housekeeping hours. The location of the hotel is a huge advantage for sightseeing and entertainment, but it can be annoying as you're in the centre of the nightlife, which can be noisy even when the window is shut. We arrived in the second week-long heatwave so far this summer, so sleeping with the window shut was impossible, but even with the window open the room was too hot to move! We weren't exactly getting to bed early, but even at 7 a.m. I'd wake up to shouting matches between god-knows-who down in the street on two days, I'm actually looking forward to my first decent night of kip now that I'm back home! Overall, some people may be fine with all the hotel's setbacks, but for the price (â‚¬72 per room per night ((â‚¬36 per person))) I feel we should have at least had more space, or a quieter location, or an ensuite toilet and bathroom, or airconditioning, or any combination thereof. I would recommend group travellers to stick to a well-rated hostel (if there's enough of you, book a dormitory room just for yourselves) and couples like us would be better advised to find someplace outside the Red Light District. I wish I'd known about TripAdvisor before I booked the place, not to imply that Mallemoolen is bad, only that I would have wanted more amenities for the price. p.s. you get bath towels (only one other review mentioned this).

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: OMmani80
Reviews.Content: what a piece of S***T hotel, rooms are totally dissapointing, if u want a place to stay and not to be noisy this is definately not the place you are looking for. Rooms are crap

Reviews.Title: “It'll do....”
Reviews.Author: littlemissomlette
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when our epic overland volcanic-ash-cloud-induced journey required a stop over in Amsterdam while we waited for a ferry back to the UK. Found that it served it's purpose as a cheap stop-over point perfectly well. We had the quad room, which is the only room with it's own bathroom. Good location- not far from the central station, and well located for easy access to coffee shops, gay district, red light district - not quite as sleazy as the red light district itself but still, don't stay here with your grandma. Despite being on quite a main street for nightlife we found it to be relatively quiet - our room was at the back of the hotel and most of the other guests didn't make much noise. Some bass from the argentinian restaurant downstairs but this stopped by midnight. Cleanliness - shabby decor, smelt of stale fags (clearly they allow smoking in rooms) but the important parts ie. sheets, towels and bathroom seemed fairly clean (bar the fag burns on the bath - not the hotel's fault - and the shabby tiger blankets) and the carpet looked like it had been given a quick once-over with a hoover. TV in room could get signal for BBC 1. Receptionist was very helpful, giving us a map recommending acitivities to do. All staff encountered were helpful, polite and spoke good English (as most people in Amsterdam seem to). Breakfast buffet could've done with a proper fry-up or even a toaster, but was extensive and all you can eat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Basic Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachelhawkins
Reviews.Content: I went to Amsterdam for New Years from the 31st of Dec-4th of Jan. We arrived at the hotel at around 9pm and they had problems with our reservation which made us very anxious. What they did was put us in an amazing two story apartment for the first night and then we would go back to the mallemoolen for the remaining time of our stay. It was great! amazing apartment. Now the next day we checked into the mallemoolen the staff were so friendly and helpful and we even got a room with a shower! The room was small with a color TV wash basin and separate shower room. Everything was very clean and our room was cleaned every morning. The location is PERFECT! right in the middle of everything. So you dont have to rely on taxis and things. All and all i would recommend the hotel to a friend or couple. The stairs are crazy steep so it wouldn't suit elderly travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff, good location, pleasant stay, getting what you paid for.”
Reviews.Author: euroandpoundsrock
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here for two nights. There is someone at the front desk 24 hours a day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a breakfast served every morning. When we were given our key, we were told that we could leave the key at the front desk when we leave and just pick it up when we get back, just so it would not get lost or stolen. In order to get into our room each time (since we were staying in the same hotel but essentially next door), we got someone at the front desk to buzz us past the front door. There is no elevator, so we walked up 3 flights of really, really narrow stairs. The ceiling in the hallway is pretty low, but we are pretty big guys and we managed it just fine. We stayed in room #10, which had twin beds, a sink, a TV, two chairs, and a small table. The room was small and a little hard to maneuver around, but we managed just fine. Whenever we would first enter the room, it would smell like someone had been smoking drugs in it, but we would just open the windows and after a few minutes the smell mostly went away. (It is a smoker-friendly hotel and allows smoking in the rooms). Down the hall there was a single communal toilet with and sink with a lock for the door and in another room was a single communal shower, which had a lock for the door as well. We were told we could use any of showers or toilets on other floors as well if we wanted. Our particular floor's shower had a window looking into a small alley on top of the roof of the hotel, but there was a curtain between the window and the shower and then another curtain between the shower and the door to the shower room. The hotel provided us with towels and some soap. The sheets for the beds were largely clean, but the blanket had a few spots on it that I just avoided. The hotel is located just a few blocks from Centraal Station, there are a number of "coffee shops" and bars both on the block and nearby. You are a block away from the red light district, a few blocks away from Dam square, but you are about a 20 minute walk from what I think is called Rembrand Square which is generally a big scene at night. The area felt safe at night, but we were cautioned by the friendly police that past 12 or 1 am it gets a little bit less safe to hang around the red light district area, particularly if you are on a street where there is no camera surveillance (although many of the streets have such surveillance). Until around midnight though we were told it is relatively safe. When we were checking out of the hotel, we were allowed to lock up our bags in a storage room for the day. Overall, the hotel is in a very nice location, near various bike rental places, has friendly and helpful staff, the room was pretty good for what we paid for, and I would recommend it to others, particularly to people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Really awful room and disgusting shower”
Reviews.Author: Packman78
Reviews.Content: My friend and I used this hotel as we needed a cheap hotel in the centre of Amsterdam. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. Only a day before arriving a person who was travelling could no longer travel. I emailed the hotel and they were able to change our booking to a 2 bed instead of a 3 bed room. We arrived very early and the staff were very friendly and allowed us to use the luggage room until our room was ready. The location itself is excellant. It is literally a few minutes and several hundred metres from the central station. It is located in the heart of the red light district near to loads of coffeeshops, bars and restaurants. This early promise though came crashing down when we got our room keys. Our room was on the 2nd floor and was incredibly small. The first thing that hit us was the odd smell in the hotel and the room and a general feeling that the room was dirty and dated. This was reinforced by the presence of numerous flies in the room. The shared toilet was acceptable, but the shared shower was really smelly and felt unhygenic and dirty. Further to this there was no hot water on the second day of our stay. Although the location is superb, this is about as bad as it gets for a hotel room in the westernised world. Do not take a partner to this hotel and if anyone likes their comforts this is not the place to go. An awful hotel room and I left feeling I needed a good clean. I would suggest that if you want a basic and cheap place to stay, then try the St Christopher's Inn located in the same area. This is a really poor hotel that needs a serious refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: FustyBox
Reviews.Content: I read some bad reviews before I went and expected the worst. On arrival I found the staff to be friendly, helpful, and efficient. My room was on the first floor (the stairs are typically steep) overlooking the street. Obviously there was a certain amount of noise from the street below but it was good to sit and watch the world go by. The room was clean, quite small and functional but catered for my needs admirably. The shared shower and toilet facilities were also clean and more than adequate. The buffet breakfast included in the price set me up for the day. Located a few minutes walk from the station I was able to reach all the places I wished to visit comfortably on foot. Warmoesstraat hosts a wide variety of bars and restaurants (even a smoking bar). I will certainly visit again. I booked through www.hotels.nl

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: DublinRobbie
Reviews.Content: My other half & I have just returned from the hotel today after a 3 night stay. Have to say I loved it. Really did. Cosy little room, central location (5 mins to Dam Square, Centraal Station, Trams.....), friendly staff and to be honest you get what you pay for. We got clean towles, new soap, plastic cups and our beds made each day. Our room was at the back of the hotel (room 6), had 2 single beds right beside eachother, little table with 2 chairs, small wardobe, big window and a sink. The loo was just across the hall as was the shower room. Alot can be heard from the loo so be aware. Oh also there are security cameras on each floor so if like me you feel the need to wander to the loo in the middle of the night half dessed, you will be seen. Ahem. We had read the reviews on here and so were wondering about the stairs and they did not fail to dissapoint, we had a laugh each time trying to get up and down. Especially when drunk or exhausted fom walking all day. Any issues, and we only had 1, was nothing at all to do with the hotel staff but more to do with the inconciderate group of people who checked into the room acoss the hall fom us and the one beside us and proceeded to shout across at eachother and generally cause noise and discomfot for my boyfriend and I but as I said it was nothing wrong with the hotel itself but I suppose in budget accomodation such things will happen and thank god was only for one night. If you stay here ask for room 3,4, 5 or 6. Not sure about the upper floor rooms. Hope you enjoy your stay there!!

Reviews.Title: “A cheapy, but a goody!”
Reviews.Author: dewscay
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early afternoon. Checked in next door at the Koopermoolen and recieved a genuinely warm welcome from the concierge (Michael, I think?). He immediately made our children welcome and gave us a terrific first impression of the city. Upon realising we were a family he also upgraded us to an ensuite room (I didn't know we weren't in one!). After negotiating the stairs, (wow!), we entered a smallish but quite neat and tidy room containing double bed, bunk beds, TV and ensuite. Not the Hilton, but definitely not a flea-pit either! The position of the hotel is great, right in among restaurants, bars, cafe's. You're close to Centraal Station, Dam Square, shopping etc, and yes, right next to the Red Light Area, but not in it! This hotel suited our needs perfectly and whilst there were probably a few uncomfortable "cover your eyes kids!" moments, these were far outweighed by the positives. For a budget bed, right in the heart of Amsterdam, you wouldn't go past the Mallemoolen!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Lou084
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel (after reading these quite mixed reviews) I have to say that we were slightly concerned but upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised! Yes, the rooms are rather basic and you have to share the bathrooms but it's a small price to pay as the staff were friendly, the location is excellent and for the price I think it's a definate bargain. I've visited Amsterdam numerous times and have stayed in a variety of places (hostels, 5 star hotels and a rented apartment) and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a cheap getaway to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good place. amazing name!”
Reviews.Author: Hannzie
Reviews.Content: When we booked up this hotel, we were looking for as cheap as we could get, and we did well! Â£66 pp for three nights (there were three of us). We wern't expecting much of the hotel, due to the cheapness, although were pleased to find out this price included breakfast! We got into Amsterdam at about 10am and were able to check in and go up to our room then, rather than have to wait until 12, which was a bonus. The room was small, with bunk beds and a single bed, a sink, a television (with quite a wide range of channels, albeit dutch channels.) and a table and chairs by the window. The location was excellent, a 2 minute walk to the Red Light district, so close but not TOO close! Would love to be able to tell you about the breakfast, but unfortunately we never got up in time to eat it! The shower and toilet were both separate and shared by the whole floor. they were probably the worst part of this hotel, and were small and dingy and had a funny smell about them! It wasn't unbearable, but still wasn't pleasant. Also when getting changed into your clothes in the shower room, it was so small most of the floor got wet, so putting trousers on without letting them touch the floor, in a tiny space was quite funny! Something that could have been anoying (but wasn't) was the fact that to get into the mallemoolen, you had to go into it's sister hotel next door (Koopermoolen) and ask to be buzzed in. The desk was operational 24 hours a day and didn't cause any trouble though! Finally, the best bit about the hotel? The name! Seriously, get stoned and talk about the Mallemoolen and the Koopermoolen and try not to laugh! Overall, small and basic, but this is what we paid for so no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, steep staircases, good breakfast but noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: Bigbrudda
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at about 10am, it was fairly easy to find - about 5 mins from central station. Very convienent for the Red Light district and is right in the centre of the main tourist area with bars, coffee shops, caffs and restaurants. You check in at the hotel next door and they buzz you in at the next doorway along. The stairs are very steep and we stayed on the second floor so had two flights to climb. Room was clean but fairly small which wasnt a problem as we only used it for sleeping. It had a tv, desk, wash basin and a window. The shower was shared but this didnt cause us any problems and if you get the temperature right gives you a really good shower. Shared toilet was a bit grimy but still ok. Breakfast was good - ham, cheese, bread, salami etc. The only major gripe was the amount of noise from the other guests and the slamming and very creaky doors which woke us up at about 4 every night. Apart from that, we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “best cheap hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: Looweeze
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here I have to admit I was a big anxious about what we had booked into. But they reviews couldnâ€™t have been more wrong. Very friendly staff, big bedroom that slept 5, good free breakfast. We did have to share a bathroom with the floor, but there are only 3 rooms on each floor and you will never have to queue for it. The shower is cleaned every morning. The stairs are a bit steep but thatâ€™s what you get in a Dutch town house. The location of the hotel is fantastic. Five minute walk from Centraal Station. Fantastic bars, restaurants and â€˜coffee shopsâ€™ are all on the same street and the red light district is about 2 minutes walk away. There was some noise at night from the street below, but it never kept us awake. All in all this was a great place to stay and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Frted3
Reviews.Content: This was without a doubt the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The tiny smelly room had only one working light, the tv was propped on a wobbly looking chair which had been placed on the desk because the aeriel wire wouldnt reach, the communal showers smelled really bad and the staff had a habit of coming into the room without any reason. The worst thing is that when I saw the state of the room and tried to cut my stay at the hotel from 3 to 1 nights I was told I would need to pay for an extra night as a cancellation fee. Stay away. It might be cheap but you still dont get what you pay for at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: creid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel over New Year with 3 friends, we had a room for 4 which was very small. It consisted of a set of bunkbeds and 2 singles pushed together with no wall space on either side. We had a TV in the room and a view over Warmeostraat. The room was clean and we had fresh towels and soap each day. We shared a shower and toilet outside the room which were kept clean. There are lots of bars and coffeeshops right on the doorstep however if you are a light sleeper it may be a bit on the noisy side with the nightlife and then the bells of the Oudekerk in the morning. Reception staff friendly and helpful, breakfast was included however we didn't manage to make it. Overall very basic but we only paid 25 euros per person per night so it you are looking for somehting cheap with no frills and in a good location this is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: fenhamNEWCASTLE
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews i was worried about going to the Mallemoolen Hotel however when i arrived i found our room to be very clean and recently refurbished. we shared a shower but for the price which includes breakfast in this central hotel we didn't mind. the rooms were cleaned daily and apart from a couple of times when the cleaner would let himself in when you were still asleep the hotel staff we're very good. If you go to amterdam you'll be struck by the cost of it so having your breakfast thrown in means your saving 5-10euro before you'v left the hotel. Don't believe the other reviews the mallemoolen is ok for a budget weekend etc..

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in Amsterdam! Don't go!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: VERY BAD HOTEL. First Night arrival Amsterdam. The hotel was overbooked and we have to found an another hotel at midnight... The Staff said that he try to reach me by the phone (I am sure that he never try). The room was guaranted by credit card ! Second night we slept at hotel De Mallemoolen. The Room was Very very small, horrible, dirty. Please don't never sleep in this "hotel"

Reviews.Title: “Would'nt keep a dog in there.....................!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: russ32
Reviews.Content: Take my advice, do not go to this "hotel". Its not a hotel. Its not even a hostel. Its a dump. Paint peeling off the walls with damp rot, dangerous light fittings, dangerous stair cases, the shower stinks, doesn't look like its ever been cleaned, its shocking. You have to check in at the hotel next door, lovely recpetion, looks clean and good place to stay. The room are next door however and they are abismal!!!! I don't own a dog and I wouldnt take it to Amsterdam. However if I did, I woudn't let it stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in the world ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excrement. The dirt encamps to its wide ones. We requested a 5 beds room and as our surprise when arriving at the room, finding a room with 4 beds of comedy and a mattress in the ground. To raise the stairs was an odyssey, cost less of raising to me the Annapurna. This hotel does not have idea of which it is a maintenance service. The baths were like sewers. The rooms that show in their official page are of another hotel. We are transacting a denunciation in Consumption. I hope that they close the hotel to them.

Reviews.Title: “pretty dodgy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Mallemoolan Hotel (and I use the term "hotel" loosely!) is located in the Red Light District, about two minutes walk from Central Station, making it extremely easy to find upon arrival in Ansterdam. However, unless you are stoned for the majority of your stay, you will find the standard of accommodation very poor! It does not even have cheapness to recommend it, as a 4-bed room costs 30 euro per person per night. In order to get to the rooms, one has to manoeuvre suitcases up an extremely steep staircase (with absolutely no help from any of the staff who all look very depressed to be working there!). If your room is on the second floor, another staircase (which is steep enough to be described as a ladder!) awaits you. We stayed in two rooms in the "hotel" due to a mix-up with reservations. The first was a 5-bed room which resembled somthing from a prison movie- shabby carpets, names etched on the wooden wall panels, a scary sculpture of a cone of french fies (!!), and a window (with no lock!) overlooking a scaffold from the next door building. The communal toilet was vile in that it apeared clean but reeked of urine, and we didn't even dare set foot in the shower. The second room was marginally beter in that it had private bathroom facilities which were cleaner in smell and appearance. However, once again, there was no lock on the window, the decor was extremely shabby, and the toilet was separated from the rest of the room with only a shower curtain! It would be quite complimentary to describe the clientele as dodgy. Basically, the Mallemoolan is a great place to stay if you intend to spend your time in the "coffeeshops" of which, a large number are located only a stone's throw away. However, if you want to be close to the pretty parts of of Amsterdam, don't stay here.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel De Mallemoolen
HotelInfo.Address: Warmoesstraat 7, Amsterdam 1012 HT , The Netherlands
